info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 18 at 2:00PM CST until December 18 at 2:30PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON DAVIS...EASTERN BEAUREGARD...CENTRAL CALCASIEU...SOUTHEASTERN VERNON AND ALLEN PARISHES... At 200 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Sugartown to Sulphur, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Westlake, Elizabeth, Reeves, Dry Creek, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Moss Bluff, Sugartown, Mittie, Ragley, Grant, Carlyss, Longville, Buller, Buhler, Harmony, Topsy, Lebleu Settlement and Gillis. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
